line_1: And when the Stuart leaning on the Scot,
line_2: Then too much fear'd and now too much forgot,

line_1: Of the poor, mean, despis'd, insulted Scot,
line_2: Oft have I heard thee mourn the wretched lot

line_1: Curs'd be that year by ev'ry honest Scot,
line_2: And in the shepherd's calendar forgot,

line_1: And the vain stiffness of a Letter'd SCOT;
line_2: Where all, but barren labour, was forgot,

line_1: Is there, that bears the name o' SCOT,
line_2: But feels his heart's bluid rising hot,

line_1: Is there, that bears the name o' SCOT,
line_2: To see his poor, auld Mither's pot,

line_1: Is there, that bears the name o' SCOT,
line_2: An' plunder'd o' her hindmost groat,
